title: Man charged with child abuse after Roswell teen shot in stomach
content:
ROSWELL, N.M. —
A 17-year-old girl was accidentally shot in the abdomen in Roswell Sunday, police confirmed.
The shooting occurred at Saddle Creek Apartments in the 1900 block of South Sunset Street at about 12:50 p.m.
Javier Harvey Salinas, 18, and the girl were doing something with the gun when it fired once, striking the girl in the abdomen, police said. Salinas fled on foot, but was taken into custody a short time later.
Police said they recovered a gun from the 18-year-old, which was reported stolen in 2013.
The girl identified him as the shooter after the incident, but said it was an accident.
Salinas is in jail and has been charged with first-degree child abuse, second-degree tampering with evidence, negligent use of a deadly weapon, unlawful possession of a handgun and contributing to the delinquency of a minor. His bond was set at $20,000 cash-only.
The girl is in stable condition at an area hospital.
